body_content.explanation: the practice of putting high taxes on imports (= goods from other countries) in order to try to stop companies from other countries selling their products very cheaply in your country, which damages your country's businesses:
examples: Many national governments formulate anti-dumping policies in order to protect domestic sellers.
The US government announced high new antidumping duty rates for some suppliers.
The measures are consistent with the World Trade Organization agreement on anti-dumping.
